description: Number of solutions to x+y+z = 0 mod (2n+1) such that x,y,z are units modulo 2n+1 i.e. gcd(x,2n+1) = gcd(y,2n+1) = gcd(z,2n+1) = 1.
formula: a(n) is multiplicative and if 2n+1=p^k is a prime power with p an odd prime then a(n) = p^(2k-2) * (p^2 - 3p + 2).
example: The only solutions modulo 3 in units are 1+1+1 = 0 mod 3, 2+2+2 = 0 mod 3 so the first element of the sequence is 2.
